fire_flag.description: 0 = only QUIC-URB simulation, no other input required

random_seed.description: accepted: -1 = use time and date to define the random number seed, >0 = use specified value to initialize random number generator

time_now.description: When the fire is ignited in Unix Epoch time, i.e., integer seconds since 1/1/1970 00:00:00 (fire must start at or after the first wind, see QU_simparams.inp)

sim_time.description: Total simulation time for the fire model. Higher value = longer simulation

fire_time_step.description: Time step for the simulation for the fire model. Higher value = less accurate simulation

quic_time_step.description: Number of fire time steps done before updating the wind field. Higher value = less accurate simulation (less coupling between winds and fire)

output_time.description: Number of updates of the fire before printing the output files for the fire model (all but emissions and thermal radiation). Higher value = less output. Use -1 to provide custom times in file QFire_ListOutputTimes.inp

nz.description: Number of cells in the vertical direction for the fire model. See below how to determine the number of cells.

stretch_grid_flag.description: Vertical spacing model: 0 = constant dz, only one value must follow

stretch_grid_input.description: Fire model cell size in the vertical direction. If stretchflag == 0: only one entry. If stretchflag == 1: as many entries as the number of cells in the vertical direction (one entry per line). Higher value = less accurate fire and fuel description

file_path.description: Files it refers to: treesrhof.dat; treesmoist.dat; treesfueldepth.dat; ignite.dat; rasterorigin.txt; gridlist. Empty quotes '': Firetec files are in the same folders of all other inputs. Path within quotes, with folder separator at the end: Firetec files are in teh specified folder

fuel_file_type.description: Format of the trees* files: 1 = all fuel types are in one file; 2 = files are broken down by fuel type and named with '_#' to reduce peak RAM use

fuel_file_format.description: Format of the trees* files: 1 = binary files have stream format (ARA format); 2 = binary files have Fortran headers

fuel_flag.description: Flag for fuel density, moisture, and height: 1 = density/moisture/height is uniform over the domain and provided with the next line input; 2 = density/moisture/height is provided through QF_FuelDensity.inp/QF_FuelMoisture.inp/QF_FuelHeight.inp; 3 = density/moisture/height is provided through Firetec file (treesrhof.dat/treesmoist.dat/treesdepth.dat) matching QUIC-Fire grid; 4 = density/moisture/height is provided through Firetec files for an arbitrary grid. The files gridlist and rasterorigin.txt must also be provided

ignition_flag.description: Ignition source shape flag: 1 = rectangle; 2 = square ring; 3 = circular ring; 4 = initial ignition locations provided through file QF_Ignitions.inp; 5 = time- and space-dependent ignition locations provided through file QF_IgnitionPattern.inp; 6 = ignite.dat (Firetec file); (NOTE: Flag of 7 seems to work better for ignite.dat - NJT)

ignition_width_x.description: Width of the ring in the x-direction. For square ring ignitions (ignition flag = 2) only

ignition_width_y.description: Width of the ring in the y-direction. For square ring ignitions (ignition flag = 2) only

ignition_width.description: Width of the ring. For circular ring ignitions (ignition flag = 3) only

ignitions_per_cell.description: Number of ignition per cell of the fire model
ignitions_per_cell.recommended_value: 100 (seems to have no effect). (CHANGED RECOMMENDATION PER QF MEETINGS: 2)

firebrand_flag.description: Flag: 0 = firrebrands are off; 1 = firebrands are on
firebrand_flag.recommended_value: 0 (firebrands are untested for small scale problems)

eng_to_atm_out.description: Flag to output (1) or not (0) the gridded energy-to-atmoshpere. File name: fire-energy_to_atmos-XXXXX.bin

react_rate_out.description: Flag to output (1) or not (0) the gridded reaction rate. File name: fire-reaction_rate-XXXXX.bin

fuel_dens_out.description: Flag to output (1) or not (0) the gridded fuel density. File name: fuels-dens-XXXXX.bin. NOTE: if 'emissions_out' is set to 4, this flag is set to 1 independently from the user choice

QF_wind_out.description: Flag to output (1) or not (0) the gridded wind components (u,v,w) for the fire grid. File names: winduXXXXX.bin = x-component; windvXXXXX.bin = y-component; windwXXXXX.bin = z-component

QU_wind_inst_out.description: Flag to output (1) or not (0) the gridded wind components (u,v,w) for the QUIC-URB grid. File names: qf_winduXXXXX.bin = x-component; qf_windvXXXXX.bin = y-component; qu_windwXXXXX.bin = z-component; qu_wplumeXXXXX.bin = w field from buoyant plumes, before mass consistency

QU_wind_avg_out.description: Flag to output (1) or not (0) the gridded average wind components (u,v,w) for the QUIC-URB grid. File names: qf_windu_aveXXXXX.bin = x-component; qu_windv_aveXXXXX.bin = y-component; qu_windw_aveXXXXX.bin = z-component. Set to 1 only if QUIC-Smoke is run for PM2.5 and CO plume transport and dispersion simulations

plume_traj_out.description: Flag to output the plume trajectories: 0 = do not output; 1 = use csv format; 2 = use binary format. File names: plume_trajectory.bin or csv; plume_mergetrajectory.bin or csv
plume_traj_out.recommended_value: 0 (Files will be huge, used for debugging only)

fuel_moist_out.description: Flag to output (1) or not (0) the fuel moisture. File name: fuels-moist-XXXXX.bin

mass_burnt_out.description: Flag to output (1) or not (0) the vertically-integrated % mass burnt. File name: mburnt_integ-XXXXX.bin

firebrand_out.description: Flag to output (1) or not (0) the firebrands trajectories. File name: firebrabrands_traj.bin

emissions_out.description: Flag for emissions: 0 = do not output any emission related variables; 1 = output emissions fiiles and simulate CO in QUIC-SMOKE; 2 = output emissions files and simulate PM2.5 in QUIC-SMOKE; 3 = output emissions files and simulate both CO and PM2.5 in QUIC-SMOKE; 4 = output emissions files but use library approach in QUIC-SMOKE; 5 = output emissions files and simulate both water in QUIC-SMOKE. File names: pm_emissions-XXXXX.bin; emissions_distribution-XXXXX.bin; co_emissions-XXXXX.bin; water_emissions-XXXXX.bin. Note; to run smoke transport and dispersion, the 'QU_winds_avg_out' must be set to 1 too

radiation_out.description: Flag to output (1) or not (0) the thermal radiation. File names: thermalradiation-XXXXX.bin; thermaldose-XXXXX.bin

intensity_out.description: Flag to output (1) or not (0) surface fire intensity at every fire time step
intensity_out.variable_name_fortran: unknown - this variable is not in the documentation - NJT

auto_kill.description: Flag to kill (1) or not (0) the simulation oif the fire goes out and there are no more ignitions or firebrands or plumes. The fuel and winds will be dumped at this last time step
